content.description: Classic moderate on the Ergonomic boulder with amazing grips. Watch out for sucker holds! Starts a little right of left arete. Sit with slopers, go up and angle slightly rightwards with a tallish but secure finish.
content.location: Starts a little right of left arete. Sit with slopers.

content.description: Ludicrously good arete climb. Beautiful, flowing line. Maybe best V5 in Roy.Sit start right arete of Ergonomic boulder with left undercling, right hand crimp. Climb arete, get a good spot.

This is one of the most classic V7s in Roy, with perfect holds on perfect rock.  It’s also one of the softest, and has a great landing. Start on the lower right hand wedge and move up the right side of the face for a couple of moves before moving left across the face on perfect, obvious crimpers. Top out on better holds after pulling to the arete.
content.location: This problem is on the standing “ergonomic” Boulder that leans slightly to the right, not connected to the main canyon wall.

content.description: A colorful, beautiful free-standing boulder with a number of excellent, slightly-overhanging problems on excellent, comfortable holds and a flat landing. Typically shaded.
